meanings.sent1: The magician's illusory tricks amazed the audience.
meanings.sent2: The mirage in the desert was illusory, disappearing as we approached.
meanings.sent3: The illusory promise of unlimited candy turned out to be a trick.
meanings.sent4: Her dreams of fame were as illusory as a rainbow in the mist.
meanings.sent5: The illusory castle in the distance was just a clever painting on a wall.

meanings.sent1: The illusory appearance of the product misled many customers.
meanings.sent2: The illusory nature of the advertisement made it hard to resist.
meanings.sent3: The illusory sales pitch convinced people to buy unnecessary items.
meanings.sent4: His smile was as illusory as a mask hiding his true feelings.
meanings.sent5: The illusory promise of eternal youth turned out to be a marketing gimmick.

meanings.definition: Of the nature of an illusion.
meanings.sent1: The painting created an illusory effect, making the scene come alive.
meanings.sent2: The music produced an illusory sense of being in a different place.
meanings.sent3: The illusory sounds of laughter echoed through the empty room.
meanings.sent4: The shadows cast by the trees created an illusory forest on the wall.
meanings.sent5: The illusory feeling of weightlessness in the dream was exhilarating.
